ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I forget schoolwork that I need to do
Notes: 1= Very Much; 2= Quite A Bit; 3= Somewhat; 4= A Little Bit; 5= Not At All

ElementDescription: I sometimes forget what I was going to say
Notes: 1= Very Much; 2= Quite A Bit; 3= Somewhat; 4= A Little Bit; 5= Not At All

ElementDescription: I react slower than most people my age when I play games
Notes: 1= Very Much; 2= Quite A Bit; 3= Somewhat; 4= A Little Bit; 5= Not At All
1= Very Much; 2= Quite A Bit; 3= Somewhat; 4= A Little Bit; 5= Not At All

ElementDescription: I have trouble remembering to do things (e.g., school projects)
Notes: 1= Very Much; 2= Quite A Bit; 3= Somewhat; 4= A Little Bit; 5= Not At All

ElementDescription: It is hard for me to concentrate in school
Notes: 1= Very Much; 2= Quite A Bit; 3= Somewhat; 4= A Little Bit; 5= Not At All

ElementDescription: I have trouble paying attention to the teacher
Notes: 1= Very Much; 2= Quite A Bit; 3= Somewhat; 4= A Little Bit; 5= Not At All

ElementDescription: I have to work really hard to pay attention or I will make a mistake
Notes: 1= Very Much; 2= Quite A Bit; 3= Somewhat; 4= A Little Bit; 5= Not At All
